abstracts.cdata!:
The outcomes of both projects was
            satisfactory and project sustainability for the Pilot
            Project is rated as highly likely, while project
            sustainability for the SECAL is more complex, though the
            sustainability of its benefits was rated as likely. The
            institutional development impact of the Pilot was rated as
            substantial, while that for the SECAL project was only
            modest. World Bank and Borrower performances in both
            projects were rated as satisfactory. Several lessons were
            learned: Quick-disbursing SECALs are inappropriate vehicles
            for supporting sector restructuring programs. SECALs in
            support of mine closures should be designed with several
            small, flexible tranches, rather than a small numberof large
            tranches. Projects designed to support setor restructuring
            should have a clear focus on poverty reduction objectives.
            The financial and economic performance of pilot projects
            activities needs to be carefully monitored. The Bank needs
            to make greater efforts to help improve the eficiency of
            mine closure activities. The Bank should consider working
            more closely with other bilateral and multicultural agencies
            that are providing seed money for establishing local
            cooperatives and other self-help institutions.
